Great atmosphere as soon as you walk in. You have to duck to walk in the door unless you're five feet tall it seems. You're then overlooking the restaurant that goes a bit of the way back. You descend several steps as you make a grand entrance to the reception area and greeted like one of the family.I ordered the Sienna pizza with a cerveza. It was great, it had mushrooms, onions and sausage. The crust was thin and flavorful and crunchy towards the edge. Everything about the place was cool, so much so that I came back two more times that week.
